meanings.definition: The process of recording electrical activity in the brain.
meanings.sent1: Encephalography helps doctors see how the brain works.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use encephalography to monitor brain activity in patients.
meanings.sent3: During the encephalography test, the brain waves danced on the screen.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a symphony of colors, like an encephalography of thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The encephalography results painted a vivid picture of brain function.

meanings.definition: The study or practice of using encephalography to diagnose neurological disorders.
meanings.sent1: Encephalography is crucial in identifying brain-related illnesses.
meanings.sent2: Neurologists specialize in encephalography to detect disorders early.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit joked about a detective using encephalography to solve crimes.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to encephalography was like a detective solving mysteries of the brain.
meanings.sent5: The encephalography class made learning about brain scans fun and engaging.
